Class Ball

java.lang.Object
  Ball
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener

This class represents a ball controlled by the player that can move freely.

Author:
Yuta Arai

Constructor Detail

Ball

public Ball(boolean mark,
            double x,
            double y,
            java.lang.String controls)
Creates a default instance of a new player Ball with the x-value of the top left point of the ball at x and the y-value of the top left point of the ball at y. The control of the ball is determined by the string controls and the state (mark or nonmarked) is determined by the boolean mark.

Parameters:
mark - - determines if the ball will be marked or not
x - - the x-value of the top left point of the ball
y - - the y-value of the top left point of the ball
controls - - the keys used to control the ball

Ball

public Ball(boolean mark,
            double x,
            double y,
            int AIKind,
            Ball[] b)
Creates a default instance of a new AI Ball with the x-value of the top left point of the ball at x and the y-value of the top left point of the ball at y. The control of the ball is determined by the string controls and the state (mark or nonmarked) is determined by the boolean mark.

Parameters:
mark - - determines if the ball will be marked or not
x - - the x-value of the top left point of the ball
y - - the y-value of the top left point of the ball
AIKind - - determines the smartness of the AI ball
b - - the surrounding balls

hitBomb

public void hitBomb(Bomb b)
Makes the ball bounce to the opposite direction of its movement when it hits a Bomb powerup.

Parameters:
b - - the Bomb powerup that the ball hits

hitBoost

public void hitBoost(BoostPad b)
Makes the ball accelerate greatly towards the direction of its movement when it hits a BoostPad powerup

Parameters:
b - - the BoostPad powerup that the ball hits

unPowerup

public void unPowerup()
Turns all powerups affecting the ball off

powerupCollide

public void powerupCollide(java.util.ArrayList<Powerup> pu)
Checks to see if the ball collides with any of the powerups on the grid. If it does, checks the type of the powerup and calls the methods that makes the ball act the way the powerup specifies

Parameters:
pu - - the list of powerups that are on the grid

move

public void move()
Increases the x or y velocity of the ball based on the key that is pressed. Increases acceleration and decceleration if JukeJuice powerup is on and disables the keyboard control if the ball is an AI. Updates the location of the ball based on the velocity and puts a cap on how fast the ball can move.

constrain

public void constrain()
Bounds the ball within the area of the window.

isFullyInRect

public boolean isFullyInRect(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double> zone)
Checks to see if the ball is fully inside any of the rectangles in the aArrayList. Returns true if it is fully inside and returns false if any of the part of the ball is outside all the rectangles

Parameters:
zone - - the rectangular area that is being checked for a ball
Returns:
true if the ball is inside the rectangles

collideWith

public boolean collideWith(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rB)
Checks to see if the ball collides with a Rectangle.

Parameters:
rB - - the Rectangle that is checked for a collision.
Returns:
true if there is a collision

wallCollide

public void wallCollide(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double> obstacles)
Changes the direction and slows down the ball when it collides with any side of the obstacle in the ArrayList obstacles

Parameters:
obstacles - - the array with the obstacle that the ball can collide with

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 java.awt.image.ImageObserver io)
Draws the ball onto the Graphics class. Does not draw the ball if the ball is in a Dead state. Draws different balls based on the Marked state.

Parameters:
g - - the Graphics class that the ball will be drawn onto
io - - the class that assists the drawing of the ball

bounce

public void bounce(double slope,
                   double bouncyness)
Sets the x and y velocity to bounce away when collided with another ball.

Parameters:
slope - - the slope of the impact of the balls
bouncyness - - the factor that the ball will bounce off

crashBalls

public void crashBalls(Ball[] balls)
Checks to see if there is a collision between two balls. If a collision occurs, calculates the trajectory of each ball so it will bounce off each other.

Parameters:
balls - - the Array of balls that this Ball can collide with

run

public void run(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double> obstacles,
                java.util.ArrayList<Powerup> p1,
                java.util.ArrayList<Powerup> p2,
                Ball[] balls)
Runs the ball.

Parameters:
obstacles - - the array with the obstacle that the ball can collide with
balls - - the Array of balls that this Ball can collide with

                Ball[] balls)
